required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Cellulite and Extracorporeal Shock Wave - a Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypothesis: The combination of extracorporeal shockwave and a daily gluteal muscle strength programme is superior to the gluteal muscle strength programme alone in cellulite.
Study design: Randomized-controlled trial
Analysis: Intention-to-treat
Outcome parameters: a) Photo, b) Nürnberger Score, c) circumference measurements, d) capillary blood flow, e) tissue oxygen saturation, f) postcapillary venous blood flow
Intervention: Extracorporeal shock wave for six sessions with 2000 impulses at both gluteal and thigh regions plus a specific gluteal strength exercise training
Follow-up: 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Nuernberger Score based on photo of cellulite

arm_group.description: 6 sessions of extracorporeal shock wave plus daily gluteal strength exercises

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sham extracorporeal shock wave plus gluteal strength exercise
arm_group.description: SHAM extracorporeal shock wave plus gluteal strength exercise

intervention.description: Extracorporeal shockwave therapy with focussed shock waves (2000 impulses, 0,25mJ/mm2) plus daily gluteal exercises

intervention.intervention_name: Sham extracorporeal shock wave plus gluteal strength exercise
intervention.description: Sham extracorporeal shock wave plus gluteal strength exercise
intervention.arm_group_label: Sham extracorporeal shock wave plus gluteal strength exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Females ages 18-65yrs Cellulite 1°-4° Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
Pregnancy Open wounds Females >18yrs or >65yrs

facility.name: Plastic, Hand and Reconstructive Surgery, Hannover Medical School
